de.javasoft.swing
Class JYTableHeader

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.table.JTableHeader
                  org.jdesktop.swingx.JXTableHeader
                      de.javasoft.swing.JYTableHeader
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.TableColumnModelListener, org.jdesktop.swingx.event.TableColumnModelExtListener
public class JYTableHeader
extends org.jdesktop.swingx.JXTableHeader

JXTableHeader extension with enhanced functionality.

Features:

  • Multi-sort gesture support
  • Configuration options for table header cell layout
  • Optional role as sub-header which allows adding per-column live-components. This role is used by JYTable to provide a filter row, that is input components for filtering column data.

See Also:
CellLayoutHint, FilterRowController, Serialized Form

JYTableHeader

public JYTableHeader(javax.swing.table.TableColumnModel columnModel)
Instantiates a JYTableHeader which is initialized with columnModel as the column model. If columnModel is null this method will initialize the table header with a default TableColumnModel.

Parameters:
columnModel - the column model for the table

setCellLayoutHint

public void setCellLayoutHint(CellLayoutHint hint)
Sets a hint for header cell layout. The hint is respected if the rendering component implements TableHeaderCell.

The default is set by the LAF, if isUIInstallable.

Parameters:
hint - the layout hint
See Also:
CellLayoutHint, SwingXUtilities.isUIInstallable(Object)

See Also:

getLayoutComponent

public java.awt.Component getLayoutComponent(java.lang.Object constraint)
Returns the Component which was added with the given contraint.

This implementation delegates to the LayoutManager if it is of type TableHeaderCellComponentLayout, returns null unconditionally if not. The constraint is expected to be an Integer representing the model index of the column with a component.

Returns:
the component which is added with the given contraint.

getPreferredLayoutWidth

public int getPreferredLayoutWidth(java.lang.Object constraint)
Returns the preferred width of the column, based on the layout of an added component with the given constraint.

This implementation delegates to the LayoutManager if it is of type TableHeaderCellComponentLayout, returns -1 unconditionally if not. The constraint is expected to be an Integer representing the model index of the column with a component.

Parameters:
constraint - the constrait with which the component was added
Returns:
the preferred width of the column based on the layout of the component added with the given constraint, or -1 if none
See Also:
JYTableHeader.TableHeaderCellComponentLayout.getPreferredLayoutWidth(JTableHeader, Object)

setSubHeader

public void setSubHeader(boolean subheader)
Sets this header's role to main header if the parameter is false, or to subHeader if the parameter is true. Update internal state as appropriate for the role.

This implementation supports showing either the title (and icon) or components added per-column with the column's modelIndex as constraint. The latter is handled by a custom LayoutManager which is installed only if the role is subheader. The default value is false.

Parameters:
subheader - a boolean indicating this header's role.
See Also:
isSubHeader()

isSubHeader

public boolean isSubHeader()
Returns a boolean indicating this header's role, true if main header, false if subheader.

Returns:
a boolean indicating this header's role.
See Also:
setSubHeader(boolean)

updateSubHeaderState

protected void updateSubHeaderState()
Synchronizes the renderer's state to this header's role, if possible and appropriate. This implementation does nothing if the renderer is not of type DefaultTableHeaderRenderer. Otherwise it updates the renderer's TableRegion property and resets the StringValue to EMPTY_UI, if isUIInstallable.

See Also:
SwingXUtilities.isUIInstallable(Object)
